alert.note: Alert for Malheur (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 8:44PM PDT until April 11 at 11:15AM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boise ID has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Malheur River Near Vale affecting Malheur County. .Warm temperatures have caused the snowpack to melt and increase river flows. For the Malheur River...including Vale...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Malheur River Near Vale. * WHEN...From late tonight to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 19.5 feet, The river will begin spilling over its bank flooding farmland between Vale and Ontario. Water will begin approaching low spots on Butte Drive. Water will approach the 36th Street Bridge upstream from Ontario about 8 hours after flood stage is exceeded near Vale. At 20.5 feet, Flooding of some county roads near the river will occur, including Westfall Road near Harper. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM MDT Monday /7:30 PM PDT Monday/ the stage was 18.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 19.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow late morning. - Flood stage is 19.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.1 feet on 02/08/1951. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 1215 PM MDT /1115 AM PDT/.
